thread.title: Briscoe offer for Kathmandu lapses

author: news.com.au
title: Briscoe offer for Kathmandu lapses
text:
BRISCOE Group's offer for outdoor clothing retailer Kathmandu Holdings has lapsed after attracting a paltry 2.27 per cent of acceptances.
BRISCOE, controlled by managing director Rod Duke, opted not to increase its offer, which amounted to $NZ1.80 a share in cash and scrip.
Before the offer was made, Kathmandu shares had traded at $NZ1.39 on the NZX. They fell about two per cent to $NZ1.50 on Friday morning. The Kathmandu board rejected Briscoe's offer saying it undervalued the chain, adding it had been valued at between $NZ2.10 and $NZ2.41 a share by Grant Samuel's independent assessment of the offer. Briscoe's stake reverts to 19.9 per cent, the most it can hold without making a full takeover. Briscoe stock last traded at $NZ2.99. Kathmandu last traded on the ASX at $A1.31, down 8.00 cents or 5.76 per cent.
